item.title: Damaged/sunken man-hole cover., 2nd November
item.description:
There are two man-hole covers in front of No.26 Hales road at junction with Rosehill Street. One was repaired about a year ago, but the other one is now sunken, damaged and rattling as cars, lorries and buses go over it - this has only happened in the last couple of weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Hales Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Disconnected Drain, 1st November
item.description:
3rd or 4th time this has been reported - it still floods at the first whiff of rain. Itâ€™s never drained since it was installed a few years ago - please send a camera down to confirm the issue. This water will pool and freeze across this junction this winter, where all the kids walk/cycle to Leckhampton High School.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No need for temporary light which is causing huge delays, 1st November
item.description:
There are currently temporary light on the St Marks end of Landsdown Road but there appear to be no works ongoing to require them. It is causing delays and tailbacks on what is one of the busiest roads on Cheltenham. Please may they be removed asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 1st November
item.description:
email rcvd 01.11.24 - You will have seen on the news recently that hedgehogs are on a dramatic decline and likely to become extinct. We have a good hedgehog population in Longlevens, especially Greyhound Gardens, but unfortunately we have had six hedgehog fatalities on the road recently. I know there is now a sign for hedgehogs you can use on the road and I am enquiring as to whether you would put one up on the entrance to Greyhound Gardens by the traffic lights? This would then at least act as a bit of a deterrent for motorists to reduce their speed and be aware that hedgehogs could be on the road. I would appreciate your thoughts.
Report on FixMyStreet
